Footer.Description: A safe and supportive platform connecting survivors with resources, community, and opportunities for healing and empowerment.
Footer.Newsletter-Description: Get updates on events, resources, and support services.
Footer.Address-Line: SA 4/2 A, Daulatpur, Varanasi-221002, UP, India

Introduction-Section.Title: About <survivor>SurvivorConnect</survivor> & JMN
Introduction-Section.Description: Empowering victims through advocacy, technology, and solidarity. Building bridges from silence to voice, from isolation to community.

JMN.Title: Jan Mitra Nyas (JMN)
JMN.Description-1: <survivor>Jan Mitra Nyas (JMN)</survivor> is an organization established in 1999 that focuses on ensuring basic rights for marginalized groups in Indian society, including women, children, Dalits, and tribal communities.
JMN.Description-2: JMN works to establish the rule of law through participatory activism, combating issues like police torture, extrajudicial killing, bonded labour, and injustice rooted in the caste system.
JMN.Description-3: JMN implements the project titled <survivor>"Empowering Victims of Torture by Strengthening victim support and building information bridges."</survivor> This project operates primarily in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, and also covers Koderma, Jharkhand.

Key-Facts.Title: Key Achievements & Impact
Key-Facts.Fact-1: Over <survivor>two decades</survivor> of grassroots experience with victims of torture and caste-based discrimination
Key-Facts.Fact-2: Uses interventions like <survivor>Testimonial Therapy</survivor> and <survivor>Meta-legal Interventions</survivor>
Key-Facts.Fact-4: Facilitated over <survivor>₹95.5 million</survivor> in compensation to survivors

Connect-Plus.Title: Connect+ Platform
Connect-Plus.Description: <survivor>Connect+</survivor> is an innovative ICT-based platform developed as part of JMN's victim empowerment project, serving as an online peer learning community and strengthening victim support through technology.

Safe-Space.Title: Safe Space & Networking
Safe-Space.Description: Secure platform for sharing stories and connecting with professionals

Resource-Hub.Title: Resource Hub
Resource-Hub.Description: Legal rights, mental health services, and government schemes

Connect-Plus.Current-Impact: <survivor>Current Impact:</survivor> <s3>42 survivors</s3> received online counselling, <s5>47 survivors</s5> trained for beta testing. Official launch targeted for <s7>August 15, 2025</s7>.

Vision.Title: Platform Vision
Vision.Quote: "A bridge from silence to voice, from isolation to solidarity."
Vision.Description: Connect+ enables evidence-based collaboration among support services and will remain active beyond project support as an ongoing hub for collaboration and capacity building.

Impact-Section.Title: Our Impact
Impact-Section.Description: Transforming lives through dedicated support and innovative solutions

OrganizationProfile.Title: About <organization>Jan Mitra Nyas (JMN)</organization>
OrganizationProfile.Description: A trusted human rights organization established in 1999, working tirelessly to ensure basic rights for marginalized communities in India.
OrganizationProfile.Full-Address: SA 4/2 A, Daulatpur, Varanasi-221002, UP, India
OrganizationProfile.Geographic-Description: Varanasi is located 797 Km South East of New Delhi and 320 Km South East of Lucknow, the capital of Uttar Pradesh.

MissionVision.Mission-Description: To provide basic rights to all, to eliminate situations that cause the exploitation of vulnerable and marginalized groups, and to start a movement for a people-friendly society through an inter-institutional approach.
MissionVision.Vision-Description: To establish a true, vibrant, and fully entrenched democratic society through the Jan Mitra concept, where there shall be no violation of civil rights granted to a citizen by the state.
MissionVision.Purpose-Description: JMN works to ensure basic rights for marginalized groups in Indian society, including children, women, Dalits, and tribes. The organization aims to establish the rule of law through participatory activism against issues such as extrajudicial killing, police torture, hunger, bonded labour, and injustice by the caste system.

ActivitiesImpact.Title: Our Work & Impact
ActivitiesImpact.Description: Over two decades of extensive work with victims of torture, police violence, and caste-based discrimination

Torture-Survivors.Title: Torture Survivor Support
Torture-Survivors.Description: Comprehensive program for survivors of torture and organized violence

Model-Villages.Title: Model Villages
Model-Villages.Description: Developing sustainable community models for marginalized populations

Women-Children.Title: Women & Children
Women-Children.Description: Protection and empowerment programs for vulnerable women and children

Advocacy.Title: Advocacy & Campaign
Advocacy.Description: National lobby, campaign and advocacy for policy change

Health-Workshops.Title: Health & Education
Health-Workshops.Description: Conducted awareness workshops focusing on maternal and child health, benefitting over 1,500 women

Youth-Leadership.Title: Youth Leadership
Youth-Leadership.Description: Organized training programs for more than 500 young leaders in activism and human rights

Food-Security.Title: Food Security
Food-Security.Description: Kitchen Gardening Initiative among 1,500 marginalized families, cultivating 10,000 quintals of organic vegetables

Child-Protection.Title: Child Protection
Child-Protection.Description: Successfully intervened and stopped over 10 cases of child marriage

CurrentProjects.Title: Empowering Victims of Torture
CurrentProjects.Description: Strengthening victim support and building information bridges through innovative technology

Online-Community.Description: Developing the Connect+ ICT platform and conducting capacity-building programs

ConnectPlus.Description: An ICT-based platform serving as a safe and accessible space for victims to share stories, seek guidance, and connect with professionals and peer support groups.

Collaboration-Impact.Description: Through strategic partnerships, we amplify our impact, share best practices, and create a united front against human rights violations across South Asia and beyond.

Philosophy.Title: Healing Through Testimony
Philosophy.Description: We believe that sharing one's story is a profound act of empowerment and a critical step toward healing and justice.

Empowerment.Title: Empowerment through Narrative
Empowerment.Description: Testimony Therapy allows survivors to narrate traumatic experiences in a structured, supportive environment for emotional healing.

Dignity.Title: Restoration of Dignity
Dignity.Description: Survivors' narratives are documented and validated in the presence of trusted witnesses, empowering and healing through public validation.

Solidarity.Title: From Silence to Solidarity
Solidarity.Description: Survivor-centered methodology combining cultural, emotional, and human rights-based recovery strategies.

Advocacy.Title: Advocacy Tool
Advocacy.Description: Testimonials influence policy discussions and institutional reports to drive systemic change and accountability.

ConnectPlus.Title: The Digital Voice: Connect+ Platform
ConnectPlus.Description: An Interactive Communications Technology platform designed to safeguard and amplify survivor voices with digital security features.
ConnectPlus.Vision: A bridge from silence to voice, from isolation to solidarity.

Community.Description: Peer support groups provided safe community spaces, reducing feelings of loneliness

Quotes.Quote1: Sharing my story was the first time I felt truly heard. It gave me back my voice.
Quotes.Quote2: The compensation was important, but what mattered more was being believed and validated.
Quotes.Quote3: Through this community, I found the strength to stand up for myself and others.

SubmitStory.Title: Share Your Story
SubmitStory.Description: Your voice matters. Share your experience securely and anonymously if you choose.

Security.Title: Security & Privacy
Security.DetailedInfo: All submissions are encrypted using AES-256-GCM encryption. We use 2FA to protect survivor accounts and provide anonymous posting options. All content is moderated to ensure safety and compliance with our guidelines.

Form.StoryType: How would you like to share?
Form.Title: Story Title
Form.TitlePlaceholder: Give your story a meaningful title...
Form.ContentPlaceholder: Share your experience, journey, or message...
Form.UploadHint: Upload your audio or video file (max 100MB)
Form.AnonymousDescription: Your name and identifying details will not be published
Form.Consent: I understand that my story may be used for advocacy and support purposes, and I give my informed consent for its use in accordance with the privacy policy.

VisionMission.Title: Empowering Victims of Torture: Join Our Movement for Justice and Healing
VisionMission.Description: Jan Mitra Nyas (JMN) works to ensure basic rights for marginalized groups and strives to establish the rule of law through participatory activism.

Vision.Title: Our Vision
Vision.Description: To establish a true, vibrant, and fully entrenched democratic society where there is no violation of civil rights granted to a citizen by the state.

ProjectGoal.Title: Project Goal
ProjectGoal.Description: To empower victims of torture by significantly enhancing victim support services through capacity building, psycho-social support, and legal assistance using technology and community-based solutions.

Rights.Title: Provide Basic Rights
Rights.Description: To provide basic rights to all individuals regardless of their background or circumstances.

Eliminate.Title: Eliminate Exploitation
Eliminate.Description: To eliminate situations that lead to the exploitation of vulnerable and marginalized groups.

Movement.Title: Start a Movement
Movement.Description: To start a movement for a people-friendly society through an inter-institutional approach.

Democracy.Title: Establish Democracy
Democracy.Description: To establish a vibrant democratic society where civil rights are protected and respected.

ProfessionalPartners.Title: Become a Professional Partner via Connect+
ProfessionalPartners.Description: Join our network of committed professionals working to support survivors through our innovative ICT platform.

ConnectPlus.Title: Connect+ Platform
ConnectPlus.Description: An ICT platform designed to foster networking, knowledge-sharing, and mutual support among survivors, human rights defenders, and stakeholders.
ConnectPlus.Vision: A bridge from silence to voice, and from isolation to solidarity.

ExpertGuidance.Title: Contribute Expert Guidance
ExpertGuidance.Description: Provide expert support and guidance to survivors through our secure online platform.

JoinNetwork.Title: Join Our Network
JoinNetwork.Description: Become one of our dedicated counselors, lawyers, and professional staff committed to supporting victims.

ExpandNetwork.Title: Expand the Network
ExpandNetwork.Description: Help us connect with additional Civil Society Organizations to create a larger network of victim support services.

LegalAdvocacy.Title: Support Legal and Meta-Legal Advocacy
LegalAdvocacy.Description: Collaborate with us to ensure victims receive justice through legal interventions and public advocacy.

BreakSilence.Title: Help Break the Silence
BreakSilence.Description: Support our efforts to document and publicly share survivor cases through blogs, media reports, and video documentation.

AmplifyCases.Title: Amplify Key Cases
AmplifyCases.Description: Help circulate public interest blogs and videos created to amplify important human rights cases.

YouthEngagement.Title: Youth Engagement
YouthEngagement.Description: Support our Youth Leadership Development Program training young leaders in activism and community advocacy.

LegalAdvocacy.KeyCasesDescription: These cases represent critical human rights violations that need public awareness and support.

KnowledgeResearch.Description: Access and share our research, publications, and communication materials designed to inform policy and enhance practice.

PublicBlogs.Description: Open-access tools for training, advocacy, and public education on human rights issues.

Testimonials.Title: Survivor Testimonials
Testimonials.Description: Documented survivor stories and case studies that serve as powerful advocacy tools.

ResearchPapers.Title: Research Papers
ResearchPapers.Description: Policy-oriented research and analysis on torture prevention and victim support.

Recognition.GlobalReport: PVCHR's community-based survivor model featured in IRCT Global Evaluation Report on Livelihoods for Survivors of Torture (2022–2024).

LeadershipProgram.Title: Survivor Leadership Program Details

Overview.Title: Program Overview
Overview.Description: Our Survivor Leadership Program is designed to empower survivors of human rights violations to become advocates and leaders in their communities. This comprehensive 6-month program provides training, mentorship, and support to help survivors transform their experiences into powerful tools for change.

Eligibility.Title: Eligibility Criteria
Items: Minimum 6 months since the traumatic experience
Willingness to participate in group activities

LeadershipProgram.CTAText: Ready to begin your leadership journey? Contact us to learn more about the application process.

OrganizationIdentity.Title: Contact Jan Mitra Nyas & PVCHR
OrganizationIdentity.Description: Reach out to us for support, partnerships, or to learn more about our work in human rights protection and survivor support.

Marginalized.Title: Protecting Marginalized Communities
Marginalized.Description: Jan Mitra Nyas works to ensure basic rights for children, women, Dalits, and tribal groups across India.

Activism.Title: Participatory Activism
Activism.Description: We combat systemic injustices through community-led activism against torture, extrajudicial killings, and caste discrimination.

Mission.Title: Our Mission
Mission.Description: To secure fundamental rights for all by eliminating conditions that enable exploitation of vulnerable groups through inter-institutional collaboration.

Vision.Title: Our Vision
Vision.Description: To foster a truly democratic society where civil rights are respected, protected, and never violated under the Jan Mitra concept.

SupportStatement.Title: Statement of Support
SupportStatement.Description: Victim support is as vital as healthcare. We believe in comprehensive care for survivors of human rights violations.
SupportStatement.Initiative: Our project 'Empowering Victims of Torture' strengthens victim support through capacity building, psychosocial care, and legal assistance.

EmergencyHelp.Title: Emergency Help & Support
EmergencyHelp.Description: Immediate assistance available 24/7 for crisis situations and urgent support needs

CallToAction.Title: Join Our Movement for Justice

Quotes.Injustice: Injustice doesn't only affect those falsely accused — it thrives in the silent suffering of innocent hearts left unheard.

ProjectOverview.Title: Empowering Victims of Torture: Events & Activities
ProjectOverview.Description: Tracking our journey in strengthening victim support through capacity building, psychosocial care, and legal assistance across Varanasi and Koderma.

Goal.Title: Project Goal
Goal.Description: Empower victims of torture by enhancing support services through capacity building, psychosocial care, and legal assistance using technology and community solutions.

Locations.Title: Project Locations
Locations.Description: Operating in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh and Koderma, Jharkhand to serve marginalized communities across both regions.

Approach.Title: Our Approach
Approach.Description: Leveraging technology, research, and community-based solutions for sustainable impact and holistic survivor recovery.

Impact.Title: Expected Impact
Impact.Description: Creating lasting change through comprehensive support systems that address both immediate needs and long-term rehabilitation.

OngoingActivities.Title: Ongoing & Core Project Activities
OngoingActivities.Description: Our comprehensive approach focuses on four main content areas to ensure holistic support for survivors.

PeerSupport.Title: Peer Support & Capacity Building
PeerSupport.Description: Strengthening community networks and building survivor capacity through training and digital platforms.
PeerSupport.ConnectPlus: Development of interactive ICT platform Connect+

LegalEmpowerment.Title: Legal Empowerment & Tools
LegalEmpowerment.Description: Ensuring justice through legal interventions and developing assessment tools for victim-centric services.
LegalEmpowerment.Advocacy: Advocacy for compensation and legal redress

Psychosocial.Title: Psychosocial Rehabilitation
Psychosocial.Description: Helping victims process trauma and rebuild self-worth through therapeutic interventions.

Knowledge.Title: Knowledge Generation
Knowledge.Description: Conducting research and disseminating findings to improve victim support services globally.

ConnectPlus.Description: Our ICT-based platform creating safe spaces for victims to share stories and access support.

KeyAchievements.Title: Key Achievements & Events (January–July 2025)
KeyAchievements.Description: Significant milestones and impactful activities achieved in the first half of 2025.

PlatformWorkshop.Title: Platform Planning & Design Workshop
PlatformWorkshop.Description: Workshop conducted with survivors, legal experts, and mental health professionals to design the Connect+ platform.

SurvivorOnboarding.Title: Survivor Beta Onboarding
SurvivorOnboarding.Description: 47 survivors from Dalit, Muslim, and Adivasi communities trained and onboarded onto Connect+ platform.

ProfessionalNetwork.Title: Professional Network Creation
ProfessionalNetwork.Description: 14 professionals including lawyers, counselors, and social workers onboarded to provide expert support.

PilotTesting.Title: Pilot Testing Sessions
PilotTesting.Description: Two pilot test sessions conducted with 20 survivors, gathering valuable feedback for platform improvement.

TraumaFirstAid.Title: Staff Training on Trauma-First Aid
TraumaFirstAid.Description: Workshop conducted for field staff and health workers on trauma-first aid, active listening, and empathetic care.

AssessmentTools.Title: Staff Training on Assessment Tools
AssessmentTools.Description: Capacity-building session for frontline workers on ethical interviewing and data protection protocols.

StructuredSessions.Title: Structured Training Sessions
StructuredSessions.Description: Four comprehensive training sessions held in Varanasi and Sonbhadra for survivor leaders and support staff.

TestimonialTherapy.Title: Testimonial Therapy Sessions
TestimonialTherapy.Description: 70 structured testimonial therapy sessions facilitated in safe community spaces across multiple locations.

TotalInterventions.Title: Total Legal Interventions
TotalInterventions.Description: 85 legal and meta-legal interventions made on behalf of survivors of torture and human rights violations.

Compensation.Title: Financial Redressal Achieved
Compensation.Description: NHRC recommended and facilitated ₹4.1 million in compensation for 9 survivor cases of custodial torture.

CrisisResponse.Title: Crisis Response Success
CrisisResponse.Description: Emergency intervention protected 1.5 hectares of tribal farmland for Ghasia Adivasi community in Sonbhadra.

PublicAdvocacy.Title: Public Advocacy Cases
PublicAdvocacy.Description: 6 major survivor cases publicly shared through blogs and videos to raise awareness and seek justice.

IRCTReport.Title: IRCT Global Evaluation Report
IRCTReport.Description: PVCHR featured in International Rehabilitation Council for Torture Victims global report on livelihoods for survivors.

TortureFreeSociety.Title: Towards a Torture-Free Society
TortureFreeSociety.Description: Published blog article calling for justice, humanity, and reform in torture prevention efforts.

HealthAwards.Description: Jan Mitra Nyas honored for excellence in integrating justice and public health approaches.

FieldDocumentation.Description: Over 12 field-based blogs and survivor stories published on caste violence and police torture issues.

Mission-Statement.Title: Our Guiding Philosophy
Mission-Statement.Description: This comprehensive support architecture operates like a compass for justice and healing, simultaneously guiding survivors to safety, charting their path through the legal wilderness, equipping fellow travelers with essential skills, and maintaining a resilient communication hub for all participants.

Connect-Platform.Title: Connect+ Platform
Connect-Platform.Description: An ICT-based, interactive platform designed to strengthen victim support and build information bridges. Fosters networking, knowledge-sharing, and mutual support among survivors, human rights defenders, and stakeholders.

Safe-Space.Title: Safe Digital Space
Safe-Space.Description: A secure and accessible environment for victims to share stories and seek guidance.

Peer-Support.Title: Peer Support & Solidarity
Peer-Support.Description: Facilitates peer learning and survivor engagement with online counseling and support groups.

Resource-Hub.Title: Resource Hub
Resource-Hub.Description: Compiled information on legal rights, mental health services, and government support schemes.

List.Professional-Network: Professional volunteer network of lawyers and counselors
List.Sustainability: Sustainable platform continuing beyond project period

Connect-Platform.Quote: A bridge from silence to voice, from isolation to solidarity

Psychosocial-Care.Title: Psychosocial Care
Psychosocial-Care.Description: Comprehensive psycho-social support focusing on emotional resilience, mental health, and holistic recovery of victims, aligned with trauma-informed care principles.

Trauma-Counseling.Title: Trauma-Informed Counseling
Trauma-Counseling.Description: Specialized counseling services available both in-person and digitally for primary and secondary victims.

Testimonial-Therapy.Title: Testimonial Therapy
Testimonial-Therapy.Description: Structured sessions where survivors narrate experiences in supportive environments, facilitating emotional healing and advocacy.

Peer-Counseling.Title: Peer Counseling
Peer-Counseling.Description: Community-based support groups facilitating mutual storytelling and collective affirmation to reduce isolation.

Family-Support.Title: Family Support
Family-Support.Description: Family therapy interventions to address trauma-related strain and rebuild trust and cohesion.

List.Emotional-Healing: Emotional healing through structured therapeutic processes

Approach.Title: Our Approach
Approach.Description: Support aims to help victims process trauma, rebuild self-worth, and reintegrate into communities. High-risk cases are referred to specialized psychologists.

Legal-Aid-Advocacy.Title: Legal Aid & Advocacy
Legal-Aid-Advocacy.Description: Ensuring victims receive justice through the legal system alongside emotional support. Facilitating institutional and judicial interventions to secure access to justice.

Direct-Legal-Support.Title: Direct Legal Support
Direct-Legal-Support.Description: Full legal representation including advice, drafting petitions, filing complaints, and court hearing support.

Judicial-Advocacy.Title: Judicial & Institutional Advocacy
Judicial-Advocacy.Description: Collaboration with legal professionals to intervene with National/State Human Rights Commissions, courts, and other authorities.

Compensation.Title: Redress & Compensation
Compensation.Description: Advocating for compensation and redress through successful interventions with human rights commissions.

Impact.Title: Legal Impact
Impact.Compensation-Description: Compensation secured for survivors and next of kin

List.Systemic-Advocacy: Systemic advocacy for police accountability and structural reforms
List.Marginalized-Communities: Empowerment of marginalized communities (Dalit, Adivasi, Muslim)
List.Rights-Awareness: Enhanced awareness of constitutional and human rights

Empowerment.Title: Community Empowerment
Empowerment.Description: Legal aid helps survivors from marginalized communities access formal legal systems for the first time, fostering rights awareness and empowerment.

Capacity-Building.Title: Capacity Building
Capacity-Building.Description: Strengthening support services through comprehensive programs for victims, community leaders, and human rights defenders.

Training-Workshops.Title: Training Workshops
Training-Workshops.Description: Sessions covering trauma management, coping mechanisms, legal rights, and self-care strategies for recovery and advocacy.

Tools-Resources.Title: Tools for HR Defenders
Tools-Resources.Description: Evidence-based methodologies and tools to recognize, address, and manage trauma in communities and themselves.

Needs-Assessment.Title: Needs Assessment Tools
Needs-Assessment.Description: Victim-centric tools for organizational self-assessment and individual needs evaluation to tailor interventions effectively.

Knowledge-Dissemination.Title: Knowledge Dissemination
Knowledge-Dissemination.Description: Documenting and sharing findings, best practices, and lessons through publications, workshops, and training manuals.

List.Global-Knowledge-Contribution: Contribution to global knowledge on trauma recovery

Research-Impact.Title: Research Impact
Research-Impact.Description: Our action-oriented research informs policy and enhances practice in torture prevention, contributing to the global body of knowledge on trauma recovery.

Introduction-Section.Title: Research & <highlight>Publications</highlight>
Introduction-Section.Description: Documenting and disseminating knowledge to inform policy, strengthen victim support practices, and contribute to the global body of knowledge on trauma recovery and human rights advocacy.

Library-Analogy.Title: A Community Library of Survivor Narratives
Library-Analogy.Description-1: This section functions like a community library built from <survivor>survivor narratives and expert analysis</survivor>.
Library-Analogy.Description-2: It not only stores reports and case studies but also acts as a public record, ensuring that the experiences of torture victims are translated into evidence that can influence policy and strengthen global best practices.

Image-Placeholder.Research-Documentation: Image: Research documentation and data analysis in progress

Research-Impact.Title: Research Impact
Research-Impact.Description: Our action-oriented research focuses on the effectiveness of victim support services and the impact of various psycho-social interventions, including testimony therapy, contributing to evidence-based practices in torture prevention and victim support.

Research-Activities.Title: Research Activities & Contributions
Research-Activities.Description: January–July 2025: Action-oriented research to enhance practice in torture prevention and victim support.

Global-Research.Title: Global Research & Evaluation
Global-Research.IRCT-Participation: Contributed to IRCT Global Evaluation Report on Livelihoods for Survivors of Torture
Global-Research.Comparative-Analysis: Provided case studies and data from India across 19 centres
Global-Research.Global-Visibility: PVCHR's community-based survivor model gained global visibility

Impact.Title: Global Impact
Impact.Description: 4 recommendations integrated into IRCT's global strategy, validating our livelihood justice model

Qualitative-Research.Title: Qualitative Research & Testimony
Qualitative-Research.Testimonial-Analysis: Analysis of testimonial therapy emotional and social impact
Qualitative-Research.Field-Documentation: Field documentation across Varanasi, Sonbhadra, and Jharkhand

Research-Base.Title: Research Foundation
Research-Base.Description: 19 field testimonies and 70 trauma recovery cases processed through narrative-based therapy

Policy-Influence.Title: Policy Influence & Learning
Policy-Influence.Policy-Writing: Policy-oriented writing linking field realities to national discourse
Policy-Influence.Advocacy: Advocacy for recognizing livelihood deprivation as human rights violation
Policy-Influence.Thematic-Analysis: Analysis of livelihood loss, custodial torture, and social stigma

Impact.Title: Policy Impact
Impact.Description: Findings used to advocate within Indian and global human rights frameworks

Image-Placeholder.Research-Team: Image: Research team conducting field interviews and analysis

Publications.Title: Publications & Digital Content
Publications.Description: Findings, best practices, and lessons learned documented and disseminated through digital media, reports, and stakeholder engagement.

IRCT-Report.Title: PVCHR in IRCT Global Evaluation Report
IRCT-Report.Description: Blog post disseminating insights from global research participation on livelihoods for torture survivors

Ghasia-Adivasis.Title: Justice for the Ghasia Adivasis
Ghasia-Adivasis.Description: Case study highlighting emergency legal intervention and protection of Indigenous land rights in Sonbhadra

Survivor-Stories.Story-1: Shaheeba Bano: From Injustice to Inspiration
Survivor-Stories.Story-2: The Station House Officer said: 'We will not let your son become an MBBS doctor.'

Self-Assessment.Description: Customized organizational and individual needs assessment tools

Implementation-Narratives.Description: Survivor voices and implementation narratives documented

Workshop-Docs.Description: Empowering Survivors Workshop and counseling sessions documented

Archives-Resources.Description: Comprehensive documentation of activities, programmes, and research findings available through our digital archives.

Coverage.Title: Comprehensive Coverage
Coverage.Description: Documents major activities including programmes for survivors of torture, women, children, and national lobbying efforts

PVCHR-Blog.Description: Field reports, survivor stories, and advocacy updates

Testimonial-Blog.Description: Therapeutic narratives and healing journey documentation

Research-Contribution.Description: Our blogs serve as living archives of survivor experiences and evidence for policy advocacy

Introduction-Section.Title: News & <highlight>Media</highlight>
Introduction-Section.Description: Latest updates, public acknowledgments, media coverage, and digital dissemination efforts from our project empowering victims of torture.

Project-Focus.Title: Project Overview
Project-Focus.Description-1: This page features updates from the project <project>"Empowering Victims of Torture by Strengthening victim support and building information bridges"</project>.
Project-Focus.Description-2: The project aims to empower victims of torture by significantly enhancing victim support services through legal assistance, psychosocial care, and leveraging technology.

Highlights-Recognition.Title: Highlights & Public Recognition
Highlights-Recognition.Description: Celebrating our achievements and recognition in integrating justice advocacy with public health services.

Health-Awards.Title: JMN Honoured at Health Icon Awards 2025
Health-Awards.Description: Jan Mitra Nyas (JMN) was honoured during the Dainik Jagran-Inext Health Icon Awards 2025 for excellence in integrating justice advocacy with public health services.

Recognition.Title: Event Participation
Recognition.Description: The event featured team members, community survivors, and youth volunteers.

Documentary.Title: Documentary Showcasing PVCHR's Community Model
Documentary.Description: A documentary film by IRCT (Denmark) showcasing PVCHR's community-based rehabilitation model was screened publicly at the Health Icon Awards 2025.
Documentary.Production: Produced by International Rehabilitation Council for Torture Victims (IRCT)

Youth-Representation.Title: International Youth Representation
Youth-Representation.Description: Aditya Mishra, a law intern and survivor advocate, was selected to represent India globally at the May 18 Academy in Gwangju, South Korea.

Impact.Title: Global Platform
Impact.Description: Amplification of youth voices and survivor leadership on international platforms addressing transitional justice and human rights.

Global-Research.Title: Global Research Feature
Global-Research.Description: PVCHR contributed case studies, survivor interviews, and data from India for IRCT Global Evaluation Report on Livelihoods for Torture Survivors.

Impact.Title: Global Visibility
Impact.Description: PVCHR's community-based survivor model gained global visibility, contributing to shaping international standards in survivor rehabilitation.

Case-Studies-Advocacy.Description: Digital documentation and media advocacy amplifying survivor voices and pushing for institutional accountability.

Social-Media.Title: Social Media Advocacy
Social-Media.Quote: Injustice doesn't only happen to those falsely accused—it takes root in the silent suffering of innocent hearts left behind.

Support-Action.Title: Support Initiative
Support-Action.Description: Dr. Lenin Raghuvanshi (Founder, PVCHR) offering support to a child whose father was falsely implicated, calling it a 'testament to hope, humanity, and healing'.

Ghasia-Adivasis.Description: Emergency legal intervention conducted in Sonbhadra district to protect the Ghasia Adivasi community from potential forced displacement and secure their Indigenous land rights.
